entry.title: Newsletter #56
entry.content:
Hello, It’s #TechThursday at #namshi again!

News from the IT Team:

Hallal wrote an interesting post about Shisha: a nodejs library for creating smoke tests in no time.

We submitted some proposals to the Confoo conference in Canada: check, and support them by voting for Hallal and for Cirpo!

But what has the team been looking at over the past week? Below you’ll find the usual list of interesting articles we discovered in the past 7 days.

  • Pants: Build system by Twitter, Foursquare, and Square

  • Push notification click-through rates

  • Get your public IP address, uberfast

  • The joy of make at jsconfeu

  • JavaScript and the Browser: Under the Hood

  • Pioneerjs: javascript integration testing

  • Create an app like twitter in 300 lines of AngularJS

  • ECMAScript 6 modules: the final syntax

  • What’s next for JavaScript – ES6 Rocks

  • Write Code Every Day

  • Current #Redis cost is 1.5 man a month

  • A Chrome extension to measure everything

  • Recommended Security Reading List

  • PhpStorm 8 is out!

  • Express.js for beginners

  • Pho – BDD test framework for PHP

  • Why Companies Need Full-Time Product Managers (And What They Do All Day)

  • What 60,000 Customer Searches Taught Us about Logging in JSON

  • CSS Variables: Access Custom Properties with JavaScript

  • “Onload in Onload” or “Why you should use document.readyState”

  • Speed Up Your Bootstrap and Font-Awesome Sites Using Font Compression

  • Progressive image rendering: Good or evil?

  • DDD with Symfony2: Folder Structure And Code First

  • A better way to work with assets in Symfony 2

  • Why I changed my mind about NodeJs

  • Fixing PHP Fatal Error: Allowed Memory Size Exhausted

  • If Programming Languages were Vehicles

  • Handling multiple entity managers in symfony and doctrine, the smart way

  • Node OS

  • Easy MySQL with Docker

  • Resource management in Docker

  • Docker + Jenkins: Dynamically Provisioning SLES 11 Build Containers

  • All-in-one fully featured GUI for Redis

  • Weave creates a virtual network that connects Docker containers deployed across multiple hosts.

  • A ruby web framework where your ruby runs on both server and client

entry.title: Newsletter #50
entry.content:
Hey folks! Hope you had a great week!

Announcement:

We are looking for a senior software engineer passionate about NodeJS and a frontend designer who is passionate and kick-ass in CSS and HTML and wants to expand his skillset with some JavaScript — we <3 javascript :)

We will detail in a separate post but, for the time being, feel free to reach out to submit your linkedin / github profile to work-in-tech@namshi.com

Here are your links for this week!

  • Mind-blowing facts about Google
  • Is TLS Fast Yet?
  • Amazon RDS Now Supports T2 Instances
  • The One Big Thing That Will Reduce Software Bugs, But No One Does It
  • CoreOS and Docker through Deis: Your Paas. Your Rules.
  • The Twelve-Factor App
  • Redis 3.0.0 beta 8 is out
  • Critiquing Facebook’s new #PHP spec
  • ideavim – plugin that let’s you use vim keybindings inside a intellj based ides (phpstorm/webstorm ide
  • A very old post, but still super good, about object oriented programming in JavaScript
  • Why does windows think that my wireless keyboard is a toaster
  • Game of Hacks
  • Why I think having passion as a developer matters
  • BadUSB what if you could never trust a USB device again
  • 3 security mistakes small companies make and how to avoid them
  • Track and Audit shipments for free
  • DConf 2014: Declarative programming in D by Mihails Strasuns aka Dicebot
  • Welcome to RocksDB!
  • Alerting Dashboard for Graphite
  • Why You Can’t Learn To Code Without Open Source
  • JavaScript Promises Are Cool
  • The Top Programming Languages in IEEE Spectrum’s 2014 Ranking
  • Building a Better PHP – Part 5: Static Analysis & other CLI tools
  • dotScale 2014 – Fabien Potencier – My Take on PHP

entry.title: Newsletter #31
entry.content:
It’s TechThursday again: here’s what we’ve been excited about over the past week!

Oh, before the news, give us 3 seconds to announce that:

  • our IOS app is available in the AppStore!
  • we released a new TV commercial!
  • we are looking for a frontend and backend code monkeys!

And now…this week in Tech:

  • A PHP VM running over PyPy
  • What the heck is Hack?
  • Showcases of software built through GitHub
  • Benchmarking Redis on Elasticache
  • Debug anything with RR
  • How to clone a 10GB repo?
  • How to Shrink a Git Repository
  • Why I’m Excited About Object.observe
  • Lesser-Known JavaScript Debugging Techniques
  • 12 Git Hosting Services Compared
  • Mobile app development frameworks
  • Loading translations from a db in Symfony 2
